speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Sir, I would advise you to shift a shirt. The

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: violence of action hath made you reek as a sacrifice.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Where air comes out, air comes in. There’s

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: none abroad so wholesome as that you vent.

speaker: CLOTEN
text: If my shirt were bloody, then to shift it. Have I

speaker: CLOTEN
text: hurt him?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: No, faith, not so much as his

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: patience.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Hurt him? His body’s a passable carcass if

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: he be not hurt. It is a thoroughfare for steel if it be

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: not hurt.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: His steel was in debt; it went o’

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: th’ backside the town.

speaker: CLOTEN
text: The villain would not stand me.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: No, but he fled forward still,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: toward your face.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Stand you? You have land enough of your

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: own, but he added to your having, gave you some

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: ground.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: As many inches as you have

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: oceans. Puppies!

speaker: CLOTEN
text: I would they had not come between us.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: So would I, till you had measured

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: how long a fool you were upon the ground.

speaker: CLOTEN
text: And that she should love this fellow and

speaker: CLOTEN
text: refuse me!

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: If it be a sin to make a true election,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: she is damned.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Sir, as I told you always, her beauty and

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: her brain go not together. She’s a good sign, but I

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: have seen small reflection of her wit.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: She shines not upon fools, lest

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: the reflection should hurt her.

speaker: CLOTEN
text: Come, I’ll to my chamber. Would there had

speaker: CLOTEN
text: been some hurt done!

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: I wish not so, unless it had been

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: the fall of an ass, which is no great hurt.

speaker: CLOTEN
text: You’ll go with us?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: I’ll attend your Lordship.

speaker: CLOTEN
text: Nay, come, let’s go together.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Well, my lord.
